title: 30 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Portugal
description: These architecture firms are leading the way in Portugal and beyond. The post 30 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Portugal appeared first on Journal.
author: Architizer Editors
excerpt: Rankings updated! These Portuguese architects are pioneering a distinctive modern aesthetic defined by geometric simplicity and minimalist volumetric forms.
text: These annual rankings were last updated on June 20, 2025. Want to see your firm on next year’s list? Continue reading for more on how you can improve your studio’s ranking. Located in the southwest of Europe, Portugal’s architecture is pluralistic, site-specific and thoughtful. The country is filled with breathtaking landscapes and historical sites, while its heritage architecture reflects its complex colonial history and various cultural encounters. Specifically, when walking the streets of Lisbon, one will encounter influences from Moorish, Roman and Goan cultures (to name a few). And while Portugal’s well-preserved cities remain impressive, its modernist scene is also cause for excitement. Emerging from the Escola de Porto (now the School of Architecture at the University of Porto) were some of the most influential contributors to modernism. No three designers epitomize Portuguese modernism quite than Fernando Távora, Álvaro Siza and Eduardo Souto de Moura. Then, there’s the playful design of the Paula Rego Museum, the spatially-attuned Piscinas de Marés. Today’s architects continue to champion the ethos of the Escola de Porto through innovative volumetric forms that embrace minimalism. The aesthetic sensibilities expressed by Portuguese architects are extremely powerful yet very basic. Portuguese modernism is void of frivolous embellishments and unnecessary ornament, and perhaps that is why so many find themselves drawn to it. With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Portugal based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge. How are these architecture firms ranked? The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority: The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025) The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025) Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Portugal architecture firms throughout the year. Without further ado, here are the 30 best architecture firms in Portugal: 30. Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos © Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos is an architecture studio, located in Viana do Castelo, Portugal, founded by Valdemar Coutinho. Some of Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include: Pavilhão do Atlântico, Viana do Castelo District, Portugal Mordoma Guest House, Viana do Castelo, Portugal E. Conde da Carreira, Viana do Castelo, Portugal Casa das Gárgulas, Viana do Castelo, Portugal Building Gago Coutinho, Viana do Castelo, Portugal The following statistics helped Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos achieve 30th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 13 29. Luís Rebelo de Andrade © Luís Rebelo de Andrade The driving focus of the Rebelo de Andrade atelier is the design, development and implementation of projects that articulate the positions of the various interests involved – not always concordant — in the creation of architectural work. This involves respect for the customer’s sovereign desiderata, motivation and expectation nurtured in relation to the final outcome of the awarded project. However, as architecture is an art that to a certain extent is imposed on the public despite its will, national and local rules have been drawn up to minimise the possibility of it negatively influencing the quality of life of those who are exposed to its productions. Likewise, there is also a silent participant — the landscape – that requires thorough understanding and profound respect for its presence and form of manifestation. Some of Luís Rebelo de Andrade’s most prominent projects include: House In Travessa Do Patrocínio, Lisbon, Portugal Horse Riding Centre in Pedras Salgadas, Pedras Salgadas, Vila Real District, Portugal Eco-Resort in Pedras Salgadas, Vila Pouca de Aguiar Municipality, Vila Real District, Portugal Tree Snakes House, Braga, Portugal The following statistics helped Luís Rebelo de Andrade achieve 29th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 4 28. M2 SENOS © M2 SENOS M2.senos is an atelier of architecture created by siblings Sofia Senos and Ricardo Senos in 2007. With the collaboration of a vast multidisciplinary team, formed by experts on different areas, M2.Senos develop studies and projects of architecture, interior architecture, urbanism, rehabilitation, design and investigation, through the use of innovative strategies, as a way of integrating various themes, conception, execution, management and communication of our projects, assuring the best accompaniment to all the necessary specialties required to the optimization of the whole project. M2.Senos assume as its principle the support to the practice of arts, based on a continuous reflection on its themes, sustained on the integration of knowledge of all arts. Some of M2 SENOS’s most prominent projects include: VR Posto Comando, Vila Real, Portugal Amélia’s House, Ilhavo, Portugal PM House, Aveiro, Portugal BLS HOUSE, Ilhavo, Portugal HVM House, Aveiro, Portugal The following statistics helped M2 SENOS achieve 28th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 12 27. Arkstudio © Rodrigo Cardoso Arkstudio is a multi disciplinary platform that combines architecture, interior design, styling and photography, the platform was founded in 2013 by Margarida Matias and we work in the fields of architecture, renovation, interior design, styling and photography. Our motivation is to create cozy atmospheres, innovative solutions, and we place the user needs in the center of our proposals. The purpose of our research is to generate distinct ambiences that prioritize individual and collective well-being, combining an aesthetic with a functionality, and the legacy of Portuguese identity allied to the debugging of the Nordic language. Some of Arkstudio’s most prominent projects include: Casa Pequena, Lisbon, Portugal Prado Restaurant, Lisbon, Portugal Apartment In S. Bento, Lisbon, Portugal SISU, Cascais, Lisbon, Portugal Apartment in S. Marçal, Lisbon, Portugal The following statistics helped Arkstudio achieve 27th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 13 26. Diogo Aguiar Studio © Diogo Aguiar Studio Diogo Aguiar Studio is a Portuguese architecture studio that was established in Porto in 2016. The studio operates across the fields of Art and Architecture, designing small buildings and interiors, as well as temporary or fixed spatial installations destined for the public space, with the belief that a dual practice informs and boosts the work undertaken, as a speculative and spatial investigation. Its interests lie in the material and sensorial exploration of immersive architectural or artistic spaces, whether archetypal or ready-made, through geometric, abstract and elementary compositions, which present themselves as formal systems aware of the simultaneous experience of (a space’s) emptiness, seeking to reclaim the relevance of the shaping of space in architecture. In recent years, the practice has been awarded several nominations for international prizes, namely: Prémis FAD 2018, BigMat Prize 2019, Europe 40 under 40 Prize, Mies van der Rohe Prize 2022, among others. Some of Diogo Aguiar Studio’s most prominent projects include: Wine Tourism Building in Quinta da Aveleda, Penafiel, Portugal Nadir Afonso Temporary Museum, Lisbon, Portugal Start, Largo dos Lóios, Porto, Portugal Blue Circle, Estarreja, Portugal Garden Pavilion, Porto, Portugal The following statistics helped Diogo Aguiar Studio achieve 26th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 17 25. Fragmentos © Fragmentos Fragmentos is a collective of four architects Duarte Pinto Coelho, Marcus Cerdeira, Miguel Santos and Pedro Silva Lopes. For over two decades we have been designing the most ambitious and challenging architectural works. Every project, from a residential building to a masterplan, reflects our determination and commitment within which we dedicate ourselves to the challenges set before us. Headquartered in Lisbon, our studio has spread to Chile and Angola in an effort to connect cities and to promote diverse thinking. In 2019, believing that architecture and engineering are best achieved in close collaboration, we have expanded our services to drive the whole design process. Some of Fragmentos’s most prominent projects include: Comporta 10, Grândola, Portugal Quake, Lisbon, Portugal António Granjo, Porto, Portugal Melides, Grândola, Portugal Possidónio da Silva 37, Lisbon, Portugal The following statistics helped Fragmentos achieve 25th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 4 Total Projects 9 24. Manuel Tojal Architects © Manuel Tojal Architects Manuel Tojal Architects Studio is an architecture studio founded in 2014. We develop projects of different scales and orders, with programs such as housing, services and public space. We work in collaboration with a variety of professionals, including engineers, landscape architects and artists. We dedicate ourselves to architecture in an almost obsessive way, where the incessant search for alchemy transforms the profession into a way of living. From rehabilitation to construction from scratch, the work method seeks to achieve non-normative, creative and transformative results. We are aware of the impact of the profession, on the planet, in the city, in the countryside and on people and therefore concepts such as sustainability, heritage and technology are fundamental to us. Some of Manuel Tojal Architects’ most prominent projects include: House In Travessa Do Patrocínio, Lisbon, Portugal Latino Coelho Apartments, Lisbon, Portugal Chanca House, Mafra, Portugal Apartment in Lapa, Lisbon, Portugal House in Trafaria, Trafaria, Portugal The following statistics helped Manuel Tojal Architects achieve 24th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 4 Total Projects 7 23. arriba © arriba Architecture surrounds you every minute. At Arriba we want to enhance how you experience your everyday life through the reinterpretation of the spaces you live in, from the door handle, to the street, to the city. We want you to take a step further and enjoy all of what a perfectly tailored space has to offer. Some of arriba’s most prominent projects include: Dom Vasco, Lisbon, Portugal Galvão, Travessa do Galvão, Lisboa, Portugal Hernani Cidade, Lisbon, Portugal Bica do Sapato, Lisbon, Portugal Mouraria, Lisbon, Portugal The following statistics helped arriba achieve 23rd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 14 22. Atelier d’Arquitectura Lopes da Costa © Atelier d'Arquitectura Lopes da Costa The atelier d’arquitectura J. A. Lopes da Costa, headquartered in Ovar since 1989, has wide experience in designing projects of architecture and urbanism, as well as interior design, recoveries, remodeling and landscaping. Concerned about the quality and accuracy of our services, we are keen to ensure technical assistance from the beginning of the project until the final completion of the work. We also count on the regular cooperation of technical expertise offices enabling us to ensure and coordinate all components of the project in its different specialties. Some of Atelier d’Arquitectura Lopes da Costa’s most prominent projects include: S.G. House, Oliveira de Azeméis, Portugal M.C. House, Santa Maria da Feira, Portugal Steelform Factory, Portugal J.M.C. House , Santa Maria da Feira, Portugal A.A. House, Aveiro District, Portugal The following statistics helped Atelier d'Arquitectura Lopes da Costa achieve 22nd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 22 21. Barbosa & Guimarães Architects © Barbosa & Guimarães Architects Barbosa & Guimarães Architects develops projects in various fields of architecture, ranging from public procurement contracts, educational buildings, health centers, sports facilities, cultural facilities, hotel equipment, institutional architecture, urban design, as well as the private residential buildings, commercial facilities and offices. The capacity to approach a program, inseparable from a client in a specific physical context, history and culture, embracing the expertise we have at our disposal or in some cases even forcing new techniques, and innovation, always trying to introduce an artistic intention, which will prove decisive in the final shape of the object. When the form, function and structure are harmoniously fused in a single thing, we hit the unity, which we consider truly essential in our architecture. Some of Barbosa & Guimarães Architects’ most prominent projects include: Palácio de Justiça de Gouveia, Gouveia, Portugal Fonte Da Luz, Porto, Portugal Lamego Multi-Purpose Center, Lamego, Portugal Povoação Municipal Pool’s Complex, Povoacao, Portugal Vodafone Headquarters Building, Porto, Portugal The following statistics helped Barbosa & Guimarães Architects achieve 21st place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 7 20. ARX Arquitectos Photo Credit: Fernando and Sérgio Guerra - © ARX Arquitectos Our architecture doesn’t follow a lexicon or a stabilized language. In every new project we try to find the “vocables” for a specific language to the new context. More than searching common points between each new project and the previous, our interest focus more on finding differences. It is as if we were always returning to zero. And, at a certain level, that is our conception of innovation. Evidently this approach also opens up a vast research field. Not having to work within rigid precepts, we search an experimental path where we can test new concepts starting from what interest and fascinates us. Some of ARX Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include: House in Possanco, Alcácer do Sal, Portugal Abrantes Municipal Market, Abrantes, Portugal House in Lisbon, Lisbon, Portugal House in Leiria, Leiria, Portugal Ílhavo Maritime Museum, Ilhavo, Portugal The following statistics helped ARX Arquitectos achieve 20th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 7 19. We always seek a response with maximum efficiency and quality in creativity and professionalism on the goal of full satisfaction of customers. Our services cover a variety of activities. We can highlight architecture, sustainable design, interior architecture, rehabilitation, urban planning, design and brand image. In addition can also be considered technical analysis, topographic surveys, property valuation, feasibility studies, concept development for real estate and resorts, work supervision, etc. Some of António Costa Lima Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include: Altinho, Lisbon, Portugal House in Estoril, Estoril, Lisbon, Portugal Casa em Caxias, Oeiras, Portugal Apartment in Cais do Sodré, Lisbon, Portugal Casa no Restelo, Lisboa, Portugal The following statistics helped António Costa Lima Arquitectos achieve 19th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 4 Total Projects 9 18. Guedes Cruz Architects © Guedes Cruz Architects Guedes Cruz Arquitectos is a Lisbon-based office founded by José Guedes Cruz and dedicated to architecture and urbanism. With a very wide curriculum, its activity continues with a team of young architects dedicated to the creation of projects in the field of culture, housing, tourism, sports, well-being and health, etc., designed combining rationality, functionality and art. Some of Guedes Cruz Architects’ most prominent projects include: Elderly Persons Residence- Social Complex , Alcabideche, Portugal The Wall House, Cascais, Lisbon, Portugal Alcoutins House, Lisbon, Portugal Lifting House, Cascais, Portugal House in Alcoutins, Lisbon, Portugal The following statistics helped Guedes Cruz Architects achieve 18th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 2 Featured Projects 4 Total Projects 5 17. Ventura + Partners © António Teixeira Ventura + Partners is a company dedicated to the development of architecture, design and urbanism projects, founded in 1994 by Manuel Ventura. With offices in Portugal, USA and France — and projects in more than a dozen countries — this global studio currently employs about 130 collaborators around the world. In the last 29 years, we have been developing projects of different scales and in the most diverse architecture segments, such as commercial, corporate, residential, hospitality, industrial, healthcare, mobility and urban space. Combining a solid experience with ongoing research and innovation, we are committed to pursuing integrated and sustainable solutions through strategic planning. Some of Ventura + Partners’ most prominent projects include: Intensive Care Unit-Pedro Hispano Hospital, Matosinhos, Portugal Deloitte Digital Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal Chantre, Portugal Nefrodouro Dialysis Clinic, Santa Maria de Lamas, Aveiro District, Portugal Primavera Building, Braga, Portugal The following statistics helped Ventura + Partners achieve 17th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 2 Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 18 16. OPENBOOK © Fernando Guerra/ FG+SG Openbook, founded in 2007, is a leading Portuguese architectural firm that offers a holistic set of disciplines comprising architectural services, industrial and graphical design solutions, and interior decoration. Our set of values, a highly engaged team, and a clear vision to do all we can to contribute to a more just and sustainable society are the driving forces behind our work ethos. At Openbook, we strive to create tailored architectural solutions that provide users with unique everyday living experiences. These can range from a single-tenant residence to an innovative corporate workspace, and right up to large-scale construction projects. Our obsession with detail and function is based on the belief that quality endures beyond the ephemeral trend of the day, and the real value of our solutions is ensuring that our clients’ investment endures and fulfills their aspirations. Some of OPENBOOK’s most prominent projects include: VdA – Vieira de Almeida Building and Interiors, Lisbon, Portugal Ritz Pool Bar, Lisbon, Portugal Nestlé Campus, Lisbon, Portugal ABREU Advogados, Lisbon, Portugal Luz Saúde Vila Real Hospital, Vila Real, Portugal The following statistics helped OPENBOOK achieve 16th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 3 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 17 15. MARLENE ULDSCHMIDT ARCHITECTS STUDIO © MARLENE ULDSCHMIDT ARCHITECTS STUDIO Authentic, meaningful, respectful, always considerate. Marlene Uldschmidt Studio was born in 2005 as the artistic outlet of German architect Marlene Uldschmidt, whose fiercely creative independence needed a space where she could have the freedom to create without compromise for her clientele, whose dreams she carves out of raw materials with rigor and honesty. Based in Portugal, in the small village of Ferragudo in the Algarve, Marlene Uldschmidt Studio believes in a rigorous process that starts with drawing inspiration from the place, the clients, the story we are called to tell and the land we are honored to build upon. Some of MARLENE ULDSCHMIDT ARCHITECTS STUDIO’s most prominent projects include: CASA 103, Ferragudo, Portugal VILLA PETRA, Carvoeiro, Portugal CASA VALE DE MARGEM, Alcantarilha, Portugal GALERIA VASCO DA GAMA 26, Ferragudo, Portugal CASA DOS ABRAÇOS, Ferragudo, Portugal The following statistics helped MARLENE ULDSCHMIDT ARCHITECTS STUDIO achieve 15th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 16 14. spaceworkers © spaceworkers spaceworkers is an architecture and design studio located in Paredes in northern Portugal, directed by architects Henrique Marques and Rui Dinis. The studio based its practice on the exploration and constant search of new paradigms of contemporary architecture in order to achieve a close relation between the form and emotions. His works reflect the pragmatic vision with they face the challenges, and the critical spirit that evaluate the context that surrounds them. The works represented in the video demonstrate how the studio adapts its interventions in different contexts of space and place without ever losing the values that guide themselves. Some of spaceworkers’ most prominent projects include: Sambade House, Penafiel, Portugal Interpretation Centre of Romanesque, Lousada, Portugal BE House, Paredes, Portugal Centro de Informação da Rota do Românico, Paredes, Portugal SV House, Sobrado, Portugal The following statistics helped spaceworkers achieve 14th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 17 13. Carvalho Araújo © Carvalho Araújo Based in Braga (Portugal) and São Paulo (Brazil), Carvalho Araújo’s studio is committed to the search and reflection of different approaches in the fields of architecture, product design and creative direction, trying to combine the design practice with a more strategic view. The projects and products Carvalho Araújo are characterized by elegance and a formal containment attitude, emphasizing the quality of design, proportions and materials. The design is no reason for exhibitionism, but rather a perfectly rational and simultaneously poetic act. Both in architecture as in the design fields, rather than respond to a specific program or application, it is important for us to question the problems from a formal and strategic point of view, either in the markets but also (in the case of architectural projects) its scale, uses and interaction with the place. Some of Carvalho Araújo’s most prominent projects include: Casa na Caniçada, Braga, Portugal Gerês House, Gerês, Braga, Portugal De Lemos, Viseu, Portugal HL746, São Paulo, Brazil Galeria Mário Sequeira, Braga, Portugal The following statistics helped Carvalho Araújo achieve 13th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 1 A+Awards Finalist 4 Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 7 12. FAHR 021.3 © FAHR 021.3 FAHR 021.3 is a collaborative practice working in the intersection of art and architecture. Based in Porto, the studio was founded by two architects, Filipa Frois Almeida and Hugo Reis. The duo explores the language and methodology of architecture applied to unexpected locations and materials. Their work comes in a variety of forms, including installations, site-specific art, performances and interventions. Some of FAHR 021.3’s most prominent projects include: NOOK, Taitung, Taiwan ENSAIO 04, Povoa de Varzim, Portugal NAPPE, Taipei, Taiwan Metamorfose, Porto, Portugal Fragments, Porto, Portugal The following statistics helped FAHR 021.3 achieve 12th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 7 Total Projects 13 11. PAULO MARTINS ARQ&DESIGN © PAULO MARTINS ARQ&DESIGN The mission of our company is to develop solutions framed on the excellence of the study and development of architecture and urbanism projects as well as product and interior design. Since the very early stages of conception, each project is carefully approached in what regards the construction location, the environmental context and requirements, as well as the expectations of the final costumers, allowing to propose high valued architectural services. An important part of our mission takes place on an international context, allowing us to export as well as import novel architecture and design concepts and solutions. This allows us to offer an ever growing selection of proposals for the highest demanding customers. Our company is guided by a unique vision: propose spaces and objects that are aesthetically and formally stimulating and pleasant, always keeping in mind the requirements of the surrounding environment. Some of PAULO MARTINS ARQ&DESIGN’s most prominent projects include: Pisco House, Agueda, Portugal SH HOUSE, Sever do Vouga, Portugal GR House, Sever do Vouga, Portugal Park House, Aveiro, Portugal AR VINHOS, Aveiro, Portugal The following statistics helped PAULO MARTINS ARQ&DESIGN achieve 11th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: Featured Projects 7 Total Projects 15 10. PROMONTORIO © PROMONTORIO PROMONTORIO is a full-service architecture, planning, landscaping, interior design and graphics team that began in Lisbon in 1990 as an experimental studio. It consistently grew into a practice of fifty architects, planners, landscape architects, interior designers and graphic designers.Underlying its approach to the urban form, the work of PROMONTORIO has often been identified with the pursuit of a ‘system of robustness’ (i.e. solidity, stability and durability) both in terms of representational meaning and technical research. This in turn, has been implemented and tested in vast construction sites and under challenging time and budget constrains. Our process springs from a dynamic and focused design culture that fosters collaboration above all. Some of PROMONTORIO’s most prominent projects include: LU MAINZ L’And Vineyards Hotel, Montemor-o-Novo, Portugal Embassy of Egypt , Lisbon, Portugal GS1 Portugal, Lisbon, Portugal A Square in Summer, Lisbon, Portugal The following statistics helped PROMONTORIO achieve 10th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 8 Total Projects 13 9. OODA Architecture © OODA Architecture OODA is an architecture practice based in Porto. Established in 2010, the studio is operating in both international and national markets, focused in the production of relevant, meaningful and quality spaces. Simultaneously local and global, the collective exports regional architecture and imports international architecture. OODA is working on a wide range of projects with different scales and programs, from singular houses to large scale residential buildings and hotels, institutional buildings to masterplans. Some of OODA Architecture’s most prominent projects include: Tower 15, Leça da Palmeira, Portugal Hoso, Porto, Portugal Matadouro, Porto, Portugal Hora Vertikale, Tirana, Albania Harare Radisson Blu, Harare, Zimbabwe The following statistics helped OODA Architecture achieve 9th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 2 Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 19 8. Tiago do Vale Architects © Tiago do Vale Architects “A clear architecture that tells a recognizable story.” We relate to architecture in an absolutely global, encompassing and multidisciplinary fashion, focusing above all on the client, on exhaustive accuracy, on transparency and on the quality of the constructed work. We’re currently developing projects and studies in architecture, urban planning and design, industrial design, furniture design and graphic arts, from single graphic elements to complete corporate images. In spite of our broad view of our company’s intervention field, we’re specially dedicated to restoration, requalification, urban rehabilitation, sustainability, and energetic efficiency, health equipments, schools and hospitality. Some of Tiago do Vale Architects’ most prominent projects include: The Dovecote-Granary, Ponte de Lima, Portugal The Three Cusps Chalet, Braga, Portugal Bottles’ Congress, Nogueiró, Portugal Caminha Apartment, Caminha, Portugal The Gafarim House, Ponte de Lima, Portugal The following statistics helped Tiago do Vale Architects achieve 8th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 3 Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 11 7. Plano Humano Arquitectos © Plano Humano Arquitectos We are young architects, living architecture as a true team work. We believe and invest in multi-disciplinary partnerships, as a richest way to achieve better quality architecture. Our project objectives and procedure are based on choices of simplicity and formal clearance, seeking for the essence of the constructed object and avowing the elements that may distort or stain his true reading. Despite these minimalist choices and rejection of excess of formal complexity, we give maximum attention to details and to the characterization of our buildings by the implementation of a strong and strategic materiality. We take advantage of cutting edge technology and its constant input’s to architectural materiality, either through new materials discovered or by transformation or conjugation of existing ones, we experiment new materials. The architectural design we developed establishes and follows a building history. Some of Plano Humano Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include: Our Lady of Fátima Chapel, Idanha a Nova, Portugal Lisbon Wood, Lisbon, Portugal Centro Pastoral de Moscavide, Moscavide, Portugal Apartment 7A Casa Cubo, São Julião do Tojal, Portugal The following statistics helped Plano Humano Arquitectos achieve 7th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 4 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 10 6. Estúdio AMATAM © Estúdio AMATAM Manuela Tamborino and João Escaleira Amaral are two young architects who decided to join skills, in order to embrace new challenges in various areas of architecture and urbanism range, whose visible result translates into the creation of the estúdio AMATAM, and Coletivo Urbano. These two structures allow them to operate in different scenarios, from Design, Architecture and Urbanism, both formal and informal strategies in different countries. The search for innovative solutions punctuated with creative approaches that brings architecture closer to an art form, together with customer satisfaction, are vectors that guide the focus of this team. The experience gained in various national and international offices, along with collaboration with other architects on specific assignments allows them to ensure excellence and professionalism in all involved projects. We provide masterplanning, architecture, interior design, product and furniture design services for both the private and public sectors. Some of Rebelo de Andrade’s most prominent projects include: RA\\ DOORM , Lisbon, Portugal House 3000, Portugal House In Travessa Do Patrocínio, Lisbon, Portugal Tree Snake Houses, Lisbon, Portugal Longroiva Hotel Rural, Mêda, Guarda, Portugal The following statistics helped Rebelo de Andrade achieve 5th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 4 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 14 4. Aires Mateus © Nelson Garrido Aires Mateus e Associados was founded by Manuel Aires Mateus, a Lisbon-based architect. The firm has completed an array of residential, cultural and refurbishment designs all throughout Portugal. NOARQ © NOARQ NOARQ is the name of a willingness of doing and thinking by hands. Since 1998, the studio evolved into an area of research, creation and production by drawing: for the land, architecture and everyday objects. Today it is located in Trofa, but it still maintains its roots in Porto. Mario Martins Atelier © © Fernando Guerra / FG+SG Mario Martins Atelier, based in Lagos and Lisbon, has worked in the field of architecture and urban planning for about 30 years. The company consists of a diverse team of permanent staff, a group of technical teams, who work together in the different areas and specializations of projects. The work from the past decades, resulted in a considerable volume and diversity of built projects: single family houses, collective housing, residential condominiums, touristic developments, private and public facilities, urban renewal and urban planning. Some of Mario Martins Atelier’s most prominent projects include: Casa das Freiras, Lagos, Portugal Carrara House, Praia da Luz, Portugal Villa Pernoi, Lagos, Portugal Lux Mare Houses, Lagos, Portugal Casa Bonança, Lagos, Portugal The following statistics helped Mario Martins Atelier achieve 1st place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal: A+Awards Winner 2 Featured Projects 13 Total Projects 16 Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking? With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year. Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York. An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted A Guide to Project Awards The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award. The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status: Project completed within the last 3 years A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value High quality, in focus photographs At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings Inclusion of construction photographs There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers. We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
html:
These annual rankings were last updated on June 20, 2025. Want to see your firm on next year’s list? Continue reading for more on how you can improve your studio’s ranking.

Located in the southwest of Europe, Portugal’s architecture is pluralistic, site-specific and thoughtful. The country is filled with breathtaking landscapes and historical sites, while its heritage architecture reflects its complex colonial history and various cultural encounters. Specifically, when walking the streets of Lisbon, one will encounter influences from Moorish, Roman and Goan cultures (to name a few).

And while Portugal’s well-preserved cities remain impressive, its modernist scene is also cause for excitement. Emerging from the Escola de Porto (now the School of Architecture at the University of Porto) were some of the most influential contributors to modernism. No three designers epitomize Portuguese modernism quite than Fernando Távora, Álvaro Siza and Eduardo Souto de Moura. Then, there’s the playful design of the Paula Rego Museum, the spatially-attuned Piscinas de Marés.

Today’s architects continue to champion the ethos of the Escola de Porto through innovative volumetric forms that embrace minimalism. The aesthetic sensibilities expressed by Portuguese architects are extremely powerful yet very basic. Portuguese modernism is void of frivolous embellishments and unnecessary ornament, and perhaps that is why so many find themselves drawn to it.

With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Portugal based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge.

How are these architecture firms ranked?

The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority:

  • The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025)

Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Portugal architecture firms throughout the year.

Without further ado, here are the 30 best architecture firms in Portugal:

30. Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos

© Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos

Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos is an architecture studio, located in Viana do Castelo, Portugal, founded by Valdemar Coutinho.

Some of Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include:

  • Pavilhão do Atlântico, Viana do Castelo District, Portugal
  • Mordoma Guest House, Viana do Castelo, Portugal
  • E. Conde da Carreira, Viana do Castelo, Portugal
  • Casa das Gárgulas, Viana do Castelo, Portugal
  • Building Gago Coutinho, Viana do Castelo, Portugal

The following statistics helped Valdemar Coutinho Arquitectos achieve 30th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Portugal:

A+Awards Finalist 2
Featured Projects 3
Total Projects 13

29. Luís Rebelo de Andrade

© Luís Rebelo de Andrade

The driving focus of the Rebelo de Andrade atelier is the design, development and implementation of projects that articulate the positions of the various interests involved – not always concordant — in the creation of architectural work. This involves respect for the customer’s sovereign desiderata, motivation and expectation nurtured in relation to the final outcome of the awarded project. However, as architecture is an art that to a certain extent is imposed on the public despite its will, national and local rules have been drawn up to minimise the possibility of it negatively influencing the quality of life of those who are exposed to its productions. Likewise, there is also a silent participant — the landscape – that requires thorough understanding and profound respect for its presence and form of manifestation.

Some of Luís Rebelo de Andrade’s most prominent projects include:

  • House In Travessa Do Patrocínio, Lisbon, Portugal
  • Horse Riding Centre in Pedras Salgadas, Pedras Salgadas, Vila Real District, Portugal
  • Eco-Resort in Pedras Salgadas, Vila Pouca de Aguiar Municipality, Vila Real District, Portugal
  • Tree Snakes House, Braga, Portugal

© M2 SENOS

M2.senos is an atelier of architecture created by siblings Sofia Senos and Ricardo Senos in 2007. With the collaboration of a vast multidisciplinary team, formed by experts on different areas, M2.Senos develop studies and projects of architecture, interior architecture, urbanism, rehabilitation, design and investigation, through the use of innovative strategies, as a way of integrating various themes, conception, execution, management and communication of our projects, assuring the best accompaniment to all the necessary specialties required to the optimization of the whole project. M2.Senos assume as its principle the support to the practice of arts, based on a continuous reflection on its themes, sustained on the integration of knowledge of all arts.

Some of M2 SENOS’s most prominent projects include:

© Rodrigo Cardoso

Arkstudio is a multi disciplinary platform that combines architecture, interior design, styling and photography, the platform was founded in 2013 by Margarida Matias and we work in the fields of architecture, renovation, interior design, styling and photography.

Our motivation is to create cozy atmospheres, innovative solutions, and we place the user needs in the center of our proposals. The purpose of our research is to generate distinct ambiences that prioritize individual and collective well-being, combining an aesthetic with a functionality, and the legacy of Portuguese identity allied to the debugging of the Nordic language.

26. Diogo Aguiar Studio

© Diogo Aguiar Studio

Diogo Aguiar Studio is a Portuguese architecture studio that was established in Porto in 2016. The studio operates across the fields of Art and Architecture, designing small buildings and interiors, as well as temporary or fixed spatial installations destined for the public space, with the belief that a dual practice informs and boosts the work undertaken, as a speculative and spatial investigation. Its interests lie in the material and sensorial exploration of immersive architectural or artistic spaces, whether archetypal or ready-made, through geometric, abstract and elementary compositions, which present themselves as formal systems aware of the simultaneous experience of (a space’s) emptiness, seeking to reclaim the relevance of the shaping of space in architecture. In recent years, the practice has been awarded several nominations for international prizes, namely: Prémis FAD 2018, BigMat Prize 2019, Europe 40 under 40 Prize, Mies van der Rohe Prize 2022, among others.

Some of Diogo Aguiar Studio’s most prominent projects include:

Every project, from a residential building to a masterplan, reflects our determination and commitment within which we dedicate ourselves to the challenges set before us. Headquartered in Lisbon, our studio has spread to Chile and Angola in an effort to connect cities and to promote diverse thinking. In 2019, believing that architecture and engineering are best achieved in close collaboration, we have expanded our services to drive the whole design process.

From rehabilitation to construction from scratch, the work method seeks to achieve non-normative, creative and transformative results. Photo Credit: Fernando and Sérgio Guerra - © ARX Arquitectos

Our architecture doesn’t follow a lexicon or a stabilized language. In every new project we try to find the “vocables” for a specific language to the new context. More than searching common points between each new project and the previous, our interest focus more on finding differences. It is as if we were always returning to zero. And, at a certain level, that is our conception of innovation. Evidently this approach also opens up a vast research field. Not having to work within rigid precepts, we search an experimental path where we can test new concepts starting from what interest and fascinates us.

The projects and products Carvalho Araújo are characterized by elegance and a formal containment attitude, emphasizing the quality of design, proportions and materials. The design is no reason for exhibitionism, but rather a perfectly rational and simultaneously poetic act.

Both in architecture as in the design fields, rather than respond to a specific program or application, it is important for us to question the problems from a formal and strategic point of view, either in the markets but also (in the case of architectural projects) its scale, uses and interaction with the place.

PROMONTORIO is a full-service architecture, planning, landscaping, interior design and graphics team that began in Lisbon in 1990 as an experimental studio. It consistently grew into a practice of fifty architects, planners, landscape architects, interior designers and graphic designers.Underlying its approach to the urban form, the work of PROMONTORIO has often been identified with the pursuit of a ‘system of robustness’ (i.e. solidity, stability and durability) both in terms of representational meaning and technical research. © Tiago do Vale Architects

7. Plano Humano Arquitectos

© Plano Humano Arquitectos

We are young architects, living architecture as a true team work. We believe and invest in multi-disciplinary partnerships, as a richest way to achieve better quality architecture. Our project objectives and procedure are based on choices of simplicity and formal clearance, seeking for the essence of the constructed object and avowing the elements that may distort or stain his true reading.

Despite these minimalist choices and rejection of excess of formal complexity, we give maximum attention to details and to the characterization of our buildings by the implementation of a strong and strategic materiality. We take advantage of cutting edge technology and its constant input’s to architectural materiality, either through new materials discovered or by transformation or conjugation of existing ones, we experiment new materials. The architectural design we developed establishes and follows a building history.

Some of Plano Humano Arquitectos’ most prominent projects include:

  • Our Lady of Fátima Chapel, Idanha a Nova, Portugal
  • Lisbon Wood, Lisbon, Portugal
  • Centro Pastoral de Moscavide, Moscavide, Portugal

Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking?

With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year.

Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York.

An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted

A Guide to Project Awards

The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award.

The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status:

  • Project completed within the last 3 years
  • A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs
  • Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value
  • High quality, in focus photographs
  • At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building
  • Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings
  • Inclusion of construction photographs

There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers.

We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
